title: Trisha Paytas denies surprise transgender announcement is a 'joke'
text:
Trisha Paytas gave fans a shock when she unexpectedly announced she was coming out as a ‘transgender gay man’ in her latest YouTube video.

But the 31-year-old has been forced to hit back at criticism over the revelation, insisting her surprise news was ‘not meant to be funny’.

The YouTube star shared a 15-minute video to her channel on Monday, titled: ‘I am transgender (female to male).

Trisha begins by telling viewers that her intention is not to cause offence or ‘set back a movement’, referring to the LGBTQ community.

After explaining that it’s ‘something [she’s] felt for a long time’, Trisha said she intends to continue using her birth name and female pronouns, although she’s not a fan of non-binary pronouns ‘they’ and ‘them’.

She continued: ‘I identify with men better. People always think there’s something wrong with me because I don’t have that many girlfriends but I do love girls — I love their sensitivity and all the stuff like that.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘That’s why I identify more as a gay man because I like guys but I also identify as a guy.’

Trisha will still use female pronouns

However, it got confusing later on in the video when Trisha said that while she one thousand percent ‘thinks’ she is transgender,

However, viewers were confused when Trisha later said that while she one thousand percent ‘thinks’ she is transgender, she also ‘a thousand percent’ identifies with her ‘natural born gender’.

Trisha explained: ‘In my head I feel like I’m a female transgender to male but also like a drag queen… I don’t like to be the center of attention, except for when I want to be the center of attention.

‘Think of like a drag queen: they do their full glam and everything but in their day to day they’re not, they’re very low-key, whatever.’

Trisha concluded the video: ‘I think that’s where I’m at and I feel really free and liberated.’

Sharing their frustration with Trisha’s comments, one Twitter user said: ‘Trisha it’s not about how you dress it’s literally that you’re 100% okay with your birth gender and you only feel like a guy bc you have guy friends and wanna date gay guys and have short hair you cannot just choose to be trans like that.’

A member of the LGBTQ community said: ‘I feel worried about how my entire identity is seen because of this video. i feel like i’m being made fun of, i feel im being treated as a joke.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

One other weighed in: ‘You literally said you CHOSE to identify as a boy. Being trans is *NOT* a choice. You cannot CHOOSE it. This stupid s**t is the whole reason trans and gnc people aren’t taken seriously and we’re struggling to make progress. The only ignorant one here is you.’

Defending herself against the backlash, Trisha tweeted: ‘It’s not meant to be funny. Because I don’t look like a traditional male on the outside , I’m a joke ? Men can wear dresses , heels and makeup u know. Close minded and ignorant.’

description: Trisha Paytas has been forced to defend herself against backlash after she came out as a 'transgender gay man' in a new YouTube video.
